tweets.html:

Today I will answer every question with "Not great, Bob!" or "The King ordered it!" #Pete #MadMen

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) April 27, 2015

Mad Men's final science is going to be Pete Campbell opening a letter from the Queen, marked "Further Instructions"

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) April 28, 2015

The way my boss feels about Karl Malone's MVP award is the way I feel about every show that won a writing Emmy while MAD MEN was on the air.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) April 27, 2015

To be fair to Brian Williams, the average brunch table will embellish reporting details at least 11 times a minute.

— Liana Maeby (@lianamaeby) April 27, 2015

There should be a special David Brent prize for the most successful TV attempts to make the audience uncomfortable.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) April 27, 2015

Spouse just described 2 Broke Girls as DVR herpes. Every time we clear it out, there's another outbreak.

— Philip Sewell (@other_shoe) April 28, 2015

BREAKING: CBS have decided to pass on Donald P. Bellisario's latest, NCISSISSIPPI.

Huh RT @DAVID_LYNCH: Dear Twitter Friends, in my opinion @DrOz is a great person and a great doctor and I support him 100%.

PUT JUSSIE SMOLLETT IN MY TOP POCKET. HE IS PRECIOUS. A PRECIOUS WOODLAND CREATURE. #empire

Netflix withholding numbers is annoying but logical; companies claiming to have Netflix numbers are annoying and illogical.

At what point in Victorian England did folks realize they shouldn't make out with people afflicted by consumption? #PennyDreadful

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
It's kind of amazing how @realDonaldTrump's tweets somehow manage to sully the dignity and respectability of Celebrity Apprentice.

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) April 28, 2015

It appears @NBCNews got a drone.

No, not Chuck Todd, a remote controlled plane with video

Pictured: Baltimore detective assigned to monitoring "teen social media" for existential threats pic.twitter.com/7Xs2rfCNcR

— Adam H. Johnson (@adamjohnsonNYC) April 29, 2015

the "30 Rock" theme should play every time Don Lemon is on TV

— slackbot (@pareene) April 29, 2015

don lemon is actually starting all these things so he can report on them, like the guy from unbreakable

— Big Username Jeb Lund (@Mobute) April 29, 2015

"I think the key thing about this whole Baltimore crisis is that we need to distill it down into a single thing to blame." -television

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) April 29, 2015

CNN proved tonight that they literally would not know a news story if it walked up and bit them on the ass #WhereIsJosephKent

— Daniel Jos√© Older (@djolder) April 29, 2015

its just so unfair that jesse williams is married to someone and it isnt me

I know I say some variation of this every week, but @amyschumer is operating on a whole different level. Get the fuck on it, everyone else.

"I still have my underwear on? This was a terrible party." QUEEN JANE KRAKOWSKI. #YoungerTV

OTP #TheFlash pic.twitter.com/YUsYA5RzqU

Eps like this almost make me wish #TheFlash were an 8-10 ep season. It's fun when the story isn't running in place, pun intended.

Reading #DatFlash #TheFlash tweets is like being on the outside of a very strange acid trip.

Wells: Fuck'em. I mean...uh...do a speed funnel.#TheFlash #DatFlash

I love #TheFlash so much, for so many reasons. This is one of them #Equality2015 pic.twitter.com/IN4WrDWFVC

This is a pretty recap-proof ep so far. "See that episode? Me too!" #TheFlash

"I promise you, Barry. We'll face each other again soon. Very soon. Like "in the season finale next month" soon." #TheFlash #DatFlash

OH THANK GOD. #TheFlash
